title: Exilium - World Geography
rawContent: # Exilium - World Geography **Type**: Continental landmass **Name**: Exilium ("Land of Exile") **Climate**: [To be determined] **Dominant Powers**: [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) (West), [Aloria](/factions/aloria) (East) **Natural Barrier**: Central mountain range running north-south --- ## Major Geographic Features ### The Central Mountains **Human Name**: **The Shieldwall** **Elven Name**: **Ered Rhain** (Border Mountains) **Orientation**: Runs north-south through the continent - **Length**: Sufficient to separate two major civilizations - **Height**: Peaks reach significant elevation (500+ ft cliffs common) - **Composition**: Brown/tan stone mountains - **Function**: Natural barrier between [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) and [Aloria](/factions/aloria) **Key Location**: [Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary) sits in the central pass of this range --- ### The Northwestern Mountains (Dragon Territory) **Elven Name**: **Ered Thîl** (Shining/Gleaming Mountains) **Human Name**: None - too remote, deep in elven territory **Location**: Far northwest of the continent, deep within [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) territory **Characteristics**: - Grey/silver peaks (taller and more forbidding than central range?) - Remote and isolated - Difficult terrain **Inhabitants**: - **Dragons** populate these mountains - No contact with elves for 400 years (since [The Elves-Dragon War](/history/the-elves-dragon-war)) - [Thorongil (Vaethor)](/npcs/thorongil-vaethor) is considered a traitor by these dragons - Unknown if any bonded dragons remain besides Thorongil **Access**: - How far from civilization? - Deliberately avoided by both powers? - [Details to be developed] --- ## Political Geography ### Western Territory: [Thelassian](/factions/thelassian) **Capital**: **[Aelindor](/geography/aelindor-the-eternal-city)** (large red settlement, central-west) - Seat of Emperor [Valandor Aethril](/npcs/emperor-valandor-aethril) - Location of the [Four Pillars](/factions/thelassian#The Four Pillars) - Seat of imperial power for 1,500 years - Ancient elven city, grand architecture - **14 days walking** from [Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary) **Settlements**: Approximately 8-10 elven settlements (Enclaves) - Red/crimson architecture distinctive of elven construction - Scattered throughout western territory - Each Enclave sends a Speaker to regional councils - [Individual names TBD] **Terrain**: - Northwestern mountains (dragon territory) - Plains and forests [details TBD] - Western extent of territory [TBD] --- ### Eastern Territory: [Aloria](/factions/aloria) **Capital**: **Thornreich** (large golden castle, far east) - Seat of the human ruler [name TBD] - Government structure [TBD] - Golden castle with fortified walls - Medieval architecture (English/French/German influences) - **14 days walking** from [Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary) **Regional Structure**: 11 Lords' Castles - Brown/tan castle architecture - Each lord controls a region? - Feudal system? Or different structure? - [Names and details TBD] **Settlements**: - The capital and 11 lord castles are most prominent - Additional villages/towns not shown on map - More spread out than elven settlements **Terrain**: - Eastern extent [TBD] - Plains, forests? [TBD] --- ### Central Territory: [Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary) **Location**: Central mountain pass, exactly between the two powers **Architecture**: Blue-roofed castle, distinctive from both powers **Geographic Position**: - Carved into central mountains at 500ft elevation - Harbor directly south at sea level - Natural mountain peak above (Thorongil's perch) **Strategic Importance**: Controls the only safe passage between east and west --- ## Distances & Travel Times ### From Veraheim to Capitals **[Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary) to Elven Capital (West)**: - **14 days on foot** - Through western territories - Presumably using the tunnel exit and then traveling west - [Road conditions? Terrain? TBD] **[Veraheim](/factions/veraheim-the-sanctuary) to Human Capital (East)**: - **14 days on foot** - Through eastern territories - From tunnel exit traveling east - [Road conditions? Terrain? TBD] **Note**: Veraheim is **perfectly equidistant** from both capitals - symbolic of its neutral position --- ### The Tunnel Through Veraheim **Length**: **Full day to cross** (walking) - Approximately 8-12 hours of travel time - Ground level passage beneath the city - East entrance → West entrance (or vice versa) - Well-lit and maintained by Veraheim guards - Regular patrol stations - Rest stops? [TBD] **Why so long**: - Mountains are MASSIVE - Not a straight line? (curves for stability?) - Multiple chambers/guard stations slow travel? - [Exact reason TBD] --- ### Total Cross-Continental Travel **Human Capital to Elven Capital** (via tunnel): - **25 days total walking** - Human Capital → Tunnel East: 14 days - Tunnel crossing: 1 day - Tunnel West → Elven Capital: 14 days - This assumes using the tunnel (safest route) **Without tunnel**: - Over/around mountains: Weeks to months longer - Extremely dangerous - Most caravans won't attempt it - This is why Veraheim's tunnel is economically crucial --- ### Travel Considerations **By Foot**: Times listed above (standard caravan pace) **By Horse**: - Faster, but how much? (2x speed = ~12 days?) - Can horses traverse tunnel easily? - [TBD] **By Dragon** (if you had one): - Veraheim to either capital: Hours? Single day? - This is why Galdor Ruincalen and [Thorongil (Vaethor)](/npcs/thorongil-vaethor) are so valuable - Neither power can match this mobility **By Ship** (to Veraheim): - From coastal cities to Veraheim harbor - Then up the South Lift - Depends on where ships come from [TBD] --- ## Coastline & Maritime ### The Southern Coast **Veraheim Harbor**: - Primary port facility - Directly south of Veraheim - Natural harbor? - Protected waters? **The Floating Docks**: - Visible as ships anchored offshore - South of the harbor - Lawless floating settlement - No official recognition **Other Coastal Features**: - Does coastline extend east/west? - Other ports in Empire or Kingdom? - Islands? [mentioned in early notes but not visible on map] - [TBD] --- ## Climate & Biomes [To be developed - questions:] - What climate zones? - Forests? Deserts? Plains? - Seasonal variation? - How does geography affect climate? --- ## Unknown Territories ### Beyond the Map Edges **North**: - Where do the mountains end? - Other lands beyond? - Dragon mountains extend how far? **South**: - Ocean extent? - Other continents? - Islands? **East** (beyond Aloria): - More human lands? - Other civilizations? - Where do the 11 lords' territories end? **West** (beyond Thelassian): - Ocean? More land? - Where does Empire's control end? - Northwestern mountains are here --- ## The Mentioned Islands In early notes, you mentioned: "Other races either live as second-class citizens or have small colonies in the neighboring islands." **Questions**: - Where are these islands? - South in the ocean? - Visible on map but not detailed? - Which races live there? - [Major development needed] --- ## To Name (Priority Order) **Immediate**: 1. Thelassian capital city 2. Aloria capital city 3. The central mountain range 4. The northwestern mountains (dragon territory) **Secondary**: 5. Major elven Enclaves (2-3 prominent ones) 6. Human lords' castles (or regional names) 7. Geographic features (rivers, forests, etc.) **Later**: 8. The islands (once we develop them) 9. Minor settlements 10. Roads, passes, other features --- ## Map Notes Based on the visual map provided: - Clear political division: Red (elves) vs Brown/Gold (humans) - Veraheim: Distinctive blue roofs, neutral coloring - Mountain ranges: Natural barriers - Floating docks: Visible as ships in water - Scale: Approximately 25 days walking across the continent **The map emphasizes**: Distance, separation, and Veraheim's strategic centrality
